text: Cecil Curran was an Irish Lawn bowls international who competed in the 1934 British Empire Games. ==Bowls career== At the 1934 British Empire Games he won the silver medal in the rinks (fours) event with Charlie Clawson, George Watson and Percy Watson. He bowled for the Shaftesbury Bowls Club in Belfast and was twice National pairs champion with Charlie Clawson in 1932 and 1939. ==References== Category:Male lawn bowls players from Northern Ireland Category:Bowls players at the 1934 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games silver medallists for Northern Ireland Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in lawn bowls
title: Cecil Curran
